website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a first microscope for a student, this one is hard to beat.
pros: Magnification up to 400x with great clarity, glass optics, included accessories, manual and customer support

customer_reviews.title: Updated review
customer_reviews.text: I originally posted a 5-star review but have had some similar challenges as another poster about using the 40x. There is not enough space between the lens and the slide to use this magnification at all unless I use no cover slide. Also, I keep noticing a dark spot in all the slides when using the under-lighting. I took a photo without the slides through the 40x lens and this is what I see. I was so excited to get this microscope but it has proved to be very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: loriella

customer_reviews.title: Good Microscope
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised at how well this scope works. We had tried the AmScope beginner scope/kit and was very disappointed and returned it. I remember having a simple but solid microscope when I was a kid and wanted my kids to share that experience. Christmas morning they opened the scope and I installed the batteries. We had also ordered a separate set of prepared slides to have some good examples to look at. The kids were able to operate the scope with a little help, and soon were finding random things to examine. For elementary school age kids I think this is a good introductory microscope.
customer_reviews.author: R. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Nice microscope for beginner, better than a "toy" microscope
customer_reviews.text: My 7-year old son is getting more interested in science, so we thought he might like looking at things under a microscope. This microscope is nice and simple. It was easy to start using right away out of the box, after adding batteries. It's a good microscope for a beginner, that's a step above a "toy" microscope. I recommend buying some additional prepared slides, as the microscope only comes with a few prepared slides. That way, kids can start looking at a bunch of things right away without the trouble of preparing slides.
customer_reviews.author: Lem S.

customer_reviews.title: Great first microscope for our 9 year old! (Until it completely fell apart after 6 uses...)
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 9 year old for Christmas. She really enjoyed the extra slides we bought with it and loves going to the local ponds and bringing back water to examine. The bottom light stopped working and then one day she took it out of the box and there were ball bearings all over the inside of the box and the adjustment slide had fallen apart. We kept it in the box and it was never dropped. BEWARE!!! May not be the best made product!
customer_reviews.author: evans5150

customer_reviews.title: Still a toy scope
customer_reviews.text: I purchased based on the number of positive reviews thinking that it would be a good scope for amateur microscopy, but unfortunately this scope is definitely in the "toy" category and only suitable for children under 12. It's actually well constructed, lightweight, and portable, but the optics are poor and the scope is missing critical features such as a fine focus and dimmable light. I gave a two-star rating based on the price/performance ratio and the fact that you can buy the much better AMScope M150C on Amazon for just $20 more and the AMScope is more than capable for high school age and older who want to do serious microscope work.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made crap
customer_reviews.text: Let's see. I ordered this microscope for my daughter. I liked different one but I decided to purchase this one based on reviews. The item came and when I opened it,it just didn't look new to me. It was scratched up and chipped. I sent it back for a replacement. Replacement came and it looked new but it is just a really flimsy,cheaply made microscope. I didn't like it. The viewing portion wasn't even screwed and was falling off. It is just a cheap construction. I decided to send it back and try the other microscope that I had in mind. Hopefully it will work. I don't recommend this item. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice microscope for the money and will be around for ...
customer_reviews.text: We originally bought the "AmScope M30-ABS-KT51 51-piece 300x-600x-1200x Metal Frame Kids Student Beginner Compound Microscope Kit" and returned it immediately, and bout this microscope. What a difference! It is well made, not plastic, and you can actually see things under it, vs the other microscope. Definitely worth spending the extra 30$ to purchase this set. It still comes with a few tools, and extra clear and pre made slides. This is a nice microscope for the money and will be around for a while. Also, I believe the lenses are glass, and the other microscope seemed like plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: One happy 10 year old boy!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my grandsons 10th Birthday. What a hit!! He loves science, so he went nuts when he saw this. Ever since he opened it up, he's been examining everything he can under the microscope! I'm very pleased at the quality. I didn't want to spend a small fortune on his first microscope, but i didn't want anything flimsy either. We were very pleased. I feel like these were the type of microscopes we used in middle school many years ago! I feel with proper care and handling this will last for many years. This came exactly as described. Highly recommend! Aayden said it was his favorite present! I felt like I did good😃😃😃
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Allen

customer_reviews.title: Way better than you'd expect for a kid's microscope
customer_reviews.text: I'm really impressed with the optical quality of this scope. I found myself just as enthralled with the microscopic world as my 10 year old. We've spent hours around the house and yard coming up with different things to look at under the scope. The upper an lower lights and the rest of the accessories make this a real keeper.
customer_reviews.author: P. Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Great Scope for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Can't beat it for the price. It is an excellent scope for a kid! I am still learning to work with it with my son, but the only annoying thing was both lights cannot go on at once. And, the 40x gets very close to the slide at times, but this is a problem with most scopes. The few prepared slides it came with are interesting and I am glad there are a few extra slides and cover pieces to make your own! I offered to stick my finger and we could look at blood, but it grossed out my son! LOL! I love microscopes, though! They are amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Momtographer

customer_reviews.title: Unplugged! NO Electronics!
customer_reviews.text: I spent a long time researching the perfect microscope for my 12 year old granddaughter. This has been an excellent choice for her. For the money and her skills/interest, I couldn't ask for a better scope. Easy to use (without my help) and sturdy. We purchased the book and extra slides. This has helped us keep the tv and electronics off and keep the kids busy while having fun learning. Worth every cent.
customer_reviews.author: Doo Dah Dae

customer_reviews.title: Awesome microscope! A whole new world when you look!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm! I gave this to my 10 year old son as a gift. Wow!!! He used it for hours and hours and hours! Everyday after school! So did the rest of the family! It came with a lot of very good slides. I purchased extra slides and blank slides to go with it. So we all found cool stuff to make the new slides and had hours of fun looking at the awesome stuff under the microscope!
customer_reviews.author: EmTheShop

customer_reviews.title: Great features and magnificatiin, poor craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: At first I was impressed with this. My 7 year old loved it! We were soon looking for all sorts of stuff to look at. But within a couple of months. The lenses of the eyepiece came apart. I'm not one to let my kids just play with it it's put up and taken down for supervised play. So they weren't rough with it. I tried reassambling them and gluing them into place and it didn't work. So now we have a great microscope paperweight. The quality is great. We were looking at the booty of a fly, hair, mouth parts of a bee, pond water, even my blood. But it's pretty useless without the lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Functions quite well for the price
customer_reviews.text: I use microscopes professionally every day and wanted a simple microscope to look at things at home. This scope performs amazingly well for the price. The 40x objective does touch the coverglass, however. TIP: if you hold the camera of your phone over the eyepiece, you can take pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Traveling Dog-Lover

customer_reviews.title: Came broken and unusable
customer_reviews.text: My daughter opened this for Christmas; we also purchased the extra set of slides. Battery compartment was corroded and the eyepiece is broken so completely unable to see anything but a dot of light. Completely disappointed as this was top of her list.
customer_reviews.author: katrina

customer_reviews.title: ...a necessary for your 'mad scientist'....
customer_reviews.text: ....bought this for my grandson for christmas....he is eight but has patience and good motor skills.....this does take some supervision...at least at first....the slides have sharp edges for one thing.....but the microscope was more than i expected......for the money it is a great deal......it has two lights...one below the slide and one over the slide....which gives you different perspectives on your sample......it is well built and easy to use....wish they had this back in "my day"....i would have had a much easier time without using a mirror to reflect light onto my slide....this makes science easy and fun
customer_reviews.author: darlene guyett

customer_reviews.title: This is a great microscope if you're 5 or 55
customer_reviews.text: This is a great microscope if you're 5 or 55. I paid double what it's being offered for here at the toy store. It's not a toy, it's a tool. One of the worst experiences of my life was when my son came home from school with lice. One of the best was watching their hearts stop beating under the microscope while they died. You can really see micro-organisms. Mom-to-mom, this baby rocks, also- school folk (get a bunch for your classrooms- this is a much better price than educational catalogues)
customer_reviews.author: Demian schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Love this microscope!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this microscope as a birthday gift for my 8 year old grandson. He loves it!!! During the first few days in particular, he looked at the pre-made slides and then started bring 'nature' into the house to examine dead bugs, leaves, dirt, etc. Under his parents' supervision, each person gave a drop of blood for perusal. (Yes, they put the needle into a flame first to make sure there would be no infection.) This a great little microscope!! Buy it!! You will not regret it!!
customer_reviews.author: MLDB50

customer_reviews.title: For the price and easy of use
customer_reviews.text: Five stars, would buy it again. Have had this for about a year. For the price and easy of use, it's been nice to have around the house. Solid enough to feel durable. While some "toys" sit on the shelf forever, at least this one gets pulled down now and then when we need to take a closer look at something. It's also VERY handy to be able to look top-down, and not just through a slide. If I had to complain, it would be nice to get even more magnification in some cases, but it works for most things.
customer_reviews.author: Styles

customer_reviews.title: this was the most amazing buy for my daughter's 8th birthday
customer_reviews.text: this was the most amazing buy for my daughter's 8th birthday! just after we bought this, we had a big outbreak of lice in our home and every single night, I picked eggs from their head and studied them in this microscope to see if they were live or dead. for $60 bucks? amazingly clear quality, so much that we can see the HEARTBEAT inside the egg which is 1mm overall! we look at pond water, cheek cells, eyelashes, leaves, dirt, ants, flower buds, even used the above light setting to study the back of a penny and find Lincoln in the memorial! TOTALLY worth the cost and has provided hours of enjoyment for our entire family. science is fascinating!
customer_reviews.author: Christin

customer_reviews.title: Great microscope - great quality, great price
customer_reviews.text: Great piece of equipment. I'll echo some other reviews and say that you must be careful when elevating the stage on the highest magnification. You will crack slide covers if you're not careful. My son loves this microscope and is really into having his own real piece of scientific equipment. It's easy enough to adjust that he can do it himself with minimal help from adults, but it's well crafted and serious enough to not be a toy. I'm impressed with the quality. The reviewers who said the casing is plastic are mistaken - it's powder-coated metal which has a texture similar to plastic, but this is a sturdy piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Microscope for Kids
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves this microscope we gave her for her 7th birthday. It is very easy for her to use and I love the fact that it is encouraging her in science. She uses the prepared slides but also spends time looking for things around the house, both inside and out, to make her own slides. I will more than likely buy this microscope for other grandkids also.
customer_reviews.author: gmreich

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price! More high-tech than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I did not expect this microscope to be as "high-tech" as it is. The ability to light the object from above and below is great, and the three different magnifications are amazing. The largest magnification will hit your specimen so you must be very attentive. I bought this intending to use it for Grade 2, however the name of this product should be called "My Third Lab Duo-Scope Microscope" because there are many variables and even I find it confusing and a bit difficult to use, so there is NO WAY an elementary student could use this instrument by themselves. Nonetheless, it's amazing quality for the price and I would definitely recommend you to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Beauchamp

customer_reviews.title: If you're not a doctor, this might be exactly what you need
customer_reviews.text: I brought this to my vet to see if the quality would be good for me to conduct fecal analysis for my horses and goats and we moved the slide between her vet-grade scope and my lab scope. Of course, her scope was superior but this lab scope showed exactly what we needed to see on the slide. She was pleased with the quality and price and gave me the thumbs up for using it on the ranch.
customer_reviews.author: Noelle.

customer_reviews.title: Defective switch
customer_reviews.text: This was the only microscope I've seen with an under and overhead light, so I thought this is a great deal. After installing the batteries we found that the top light would come on but the bottom light wouldn't. It seemed to be a bad switch. Got a replacement from Amazon a few days later and that one had a defective switch as well. the bottom light comes on but the top wouldn't unless you pushed it in real hard. I considered replacing the switch myself, but it doesn't make sense to have to fix a brand new product. Overall this looks like a pretty decent microscope for young kids. Not going for a third try with this microscope.
customer_reviews.author: A. Harvin

customer_reviews.title: This microscope was way better than I had anticipated
customer_reviews.text: This microscope was way better than I had anticipated. It has a clear view up close of the objects that the kids want to see. We also got a box of slides to look at and you can make your own. This is a wonderful microscope! Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Spend more for better quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm not impressed with this microscope. I bought it for a grandchild because it was on the Holiday Toy List or bestseller list (can't remember now after looking at so many toys). The focus is not very good (blurry) and it goes out of focus so easily. It's very frustrating for a child. I'd tell people to spend twice as much for a decent microscope. The four prepared slides are not worth the trouble....one appears to have nothing in it.
customer_reviews.author: MotherNature

customer_reviews.title: the perfect beginner microscope!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a 11 year old boy (terriE's son) and am a big science fan. For 2014 Christmas, I asked for a microscope. At the time I knew nothing about microscopes, but what I got was THE BEST SCOPE I COULD HAVE ASKED FOR!!! it is sturdy, light, and comes with everything I could ask for. All in all, this is a perfect beginner microscope, and I have had hours of fun and learning with this incredible microscope!!! Other reviews say the 400x is blurry, but none of the magnifications are blurry at all. The fact that it doesn't only do slides is a life changer, believe me.
customer_reviews.author: TerriE

customer_reviews.title: Great scope for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I have a BS in Biology and college/Middle school teaching background, to add some credibility, and I have found this scope to be a great value. Build quality is very good, as is image quality for this price range. This is a real scope, not a cheapo toy. I like the fact that it has a top light so it can be used as a dissecting scope as well as a microscope, hence the name "Duo-Scope". As others have stated, the separate fine focus is not needed, due to the accurate and quality focusing mechanism on this scope. This scope is smaller than the standard classroom scopes, but that's no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Surfer Ed

customer_reviews.title: A nicely made microscope
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for my daughter for Christmas only to get trumped by grandpa a couple months later who gave her his old digital microscope, which had a large screen, many more adjustments, and the ability to take pictures. So you can image how surprised we were to see her still using this microscope. Turns out, this microscope has a much clearer, brighter picture than grandpa's. A side-by-side comparison was pretty amazing. This is easy to operate and I'm very happy with the quality of the zoom settings.
customer_reviews.author: CDJM

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.text: I have been home schooling for several years and bought a couple of used microscopes off ebay. Should have just taken the jump and bought this one. Did some research on different microscopes in this price range. There were two that rated the best. I chose this one for the duo scope. Did not fully understand what that would really mean, but it sounded good. Pros: Great clarity, Easy to use, Love the Duo scope! My grandson is always finding new things to view. Cons: can not think of any Highly recommend for a beginning scope
customer_reviews.author: Earthsong54

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner's microscope
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful microscope for a child. I like the dual functionality as a stereoscope using the upper light source and a basic microscope using the lower light source. It comes with a nice starter kit of a few prepared slides and the supplies needed to prepare your own slides. I am a PhD experienced in cell culture and immunohistochemistry applications, so I am quite familiar with microscopes. Obviously, this isn't the quality of an expensive microscope you would find in your typical lab, but it is a great beginner's microscope at a good price for a child.
customer_reviews.author: RPowell

customer_reviews.title: Great first microscope
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my ten y/o niece's birthday a month ago. I didn't want to pay a fortune, but I wanted it to be something that would be useful and would really hold her interest. She has been fascinated and delighted with it. The microscope is set up in her room and I'm told she uses it daily. Her examination of various items has prompted her to "google" and find out more about the things she has viewed. The microscope has a light and enough magnification to REALLY see a difference between the image in the microscope and what one can see with the naked eye. If you have a budding scientist, I highly recommend this microscope.
customer_reviews.author: kindlelover

customer_reviews.title: GREAT MICROSCOPE NOT A CHEAP TOY
customer_reviews.text: You really want to see inside a cell? Buy this one. I've had several toy microscopes in my 50 years, this one is not a toy. It's great. Very easy smooth focus wheel, super easy to get everything in crystal clear focus. The 3 lens let you move through the slides from a full view to inside the cells. DON'T WASTE MONEY ON CHEAP TOYS, GET THIS ONE. The light is also a great design, love switching from under the slide to top light for looking at surfaces. Very well made body and lens, this microscope will go through college with our son.
customer_reviews.author: Blackwolfe

customer_reviews.title: Really great for beginners/intermediate
customer_reviews.text: We have looked at lots of things and have had a lot of fun with it. The only negative thing is the highest magnification absorbs a lot of light so I had to put a brighter light underneath.
customer_reviews.author: DJD

customer_reviews.title: It's decent for its price
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting the very best sort of microscope ever, but for the price, this is a pretty good piece of machinery. I did expect better accessories and felt a bit cheated by some of what was included. Food coloring for dye? At any rate, the negative field settings are AWESOME and we've used it for everything from hair strands to pollen and leaves from outside. My 8 year old is autistic and I try to encourage her and stimulate her mind whenever I can. This was an amazing purchase for the money, but as I said, the accessories are a let down.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: It works great to magnify items such as a piece of paper
customer_reviews.text: My 11 year old son absolutely loves this. It works great to magnify items such as a piece of paper, a coin, a bug's leg. You name it, he has looked at it under the microscope. It also works great to look at slides of cells. We have a lot of premade slides that he has been looking at. He can't wait to make his own. It comes with a few slides premade and all of the stuff to make your own including the dye. The price for such a great kit is awesome. Similar microscopes I looked for were at or over $100.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: My First Lab Duo Scope Microscope
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 6 year old granddaughter who is crazy for science. I bought it based on reviews that it was good quality and that the microscope did truly have lens that would let you see detail. It actually turns so that there are three viewing options when looking thru the microscope. We looked at many things - the human hair, skin, leaves, and a slide kit that had many different interesting things to look at. It says it is good for up to 18 year olds. I think it is a great starter microscope. It seems good sturdy quality and yet it is lightweight enough that is is easy for the little ones to handle.
customer_reviews.author: CLB

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic microscope
customer_reviews.text: this is a great little microscope. We gave it to my son 3 years ago and have had a lot of fun with it over the years. Just used it again tonight and was thinking again what a great purchase it was, that I stopped what I was doing to write this review.
customer_reviews.author: Sunfish

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: We just got this microscope after a week of research and "should we spend more?" conversations. We are thrilled with our purchase. Our 9 year old daughter loved this as a gift, we also purchased the prepared slides that come in a nice wood box. I think this is a great starter microscope...we have all had a great time using...including our 4 year old boy and he is pretty rough on stuff. We looked at all sorts of plant matter through the lenses. Everything worked great including the focus. I would totally recommend this as the price is great and we all loved using it.
customer_reviews.author: Red Hook

customer_reviews.title: Great microscope just be careful with focusing.
customer_reviews.text: This microscope arrived on time, well packaged and undamaged. Both lights work fine with three "AA" batteries and it is easy to focus. All lenses magnify as they should, so far as I can tell. I have only one complaint; the focus keeps pulling the slide tray up, which is good, but I cracked a slide. It would be better if there was a stop in place to prevent the slide from coming into contact with the lenses. I know it was my fault, not the manufacturer's but, it is hard to tell the slide is about to hit the lens while peering through the lens.
customer_reviews.author: Derek & Margie

customer_reviews.title: Unuseable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. My nephew has one. I purchased this microscope for homeschool and pulled it out to use the first time today. The 10x eyepiece and all 3 objectives were missing rendering it unusable. Unfortunately, it is beyond the warranty and I can't refund or exchange it. VERY DISAPPOINTED. If the system would allow, I would rate it 0....the amount of use of use we received from it.
customer_reviews.author: Lovin Life

customer_reviews.title: This is a solid item for the money and it was nice that it came with pre-prepped slides so the kids ...
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to be a real quality device. The body of the microscope was well constructed and seemed as if it would survive the abuse of the kids using it. We put the slides on that came with the microscope and were able to focus sharply with all 3 magnification lenses built into the microscope. This is a solid item for the money and it was nice that it came with pre-prepped slides so the kids had something to look at instantly. I would definitely buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Don't use the 'cleaning' tissues
customer_reviews.text: I would give this more stars but here's the thing; dirt in the lenses. The "lens cleaning" tissues that come with it are TERRIBLE. As a photographer I would never buy these. One application to clear a few specks off and I spent 30 minutes cleaning the lenses with my own lens cloth. It is a bit lighter than I anticipated. Otherwise, it works well and my daughter is loving it.
customer_reviews.author: ROM Spaceknight

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT EDUCATIONAL GIFT
customer_reviews.text: This microscope was purchased for a nine year old girl who appreciates anything science related. After all gifts were opened, she chose My First Lab Microscope to set up and view the prepared slides. She spent the better part of the day viewing and reviewing these slides. She can't wait to get back to school to tell her science teacher about her microscope and slides. In my opinion I would rather spend money on a learning tool as opposed to a toy that will become boring after several weeks. This microscope is not the highest priced one out there but ideal for a nine year old.
customer_reviews.author: maureen2455

customer_reviews.title: forth graders loved it
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my student teaching at the end of the day with my fourth grade class. It is great for looking at insects close up. Although I have not had good luck with the highest lens, the other two lenses are more than enough to see protozoa in swamp water, and the compound eye of a fly. Very reasonable price for this microscope.
customer_reviews.author: Delight Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, High Quality, Excellent Light Sources
customer_reviews.text: This microscope is amazing! I bought it for my 8 year old son for Christmas last year and he still uses it almost daily! He is always finding things he wants to look at under the microscope, and the dual lights are a great feature, I've had many microscopes in the past where the light source was very weak, this gives you two different light options and both are very bright. Also very sturdy, it's metal, not plastic, so it can stand up to whatever your little one does!
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice microscope for our 10 1/2 yo son who has ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice microscope for our 10 1/2 yo son who has enjoyed looking at different items with it. I would have liked it to be powered with an electric plug (thinking it would have stronger lighting/visual power), but our son is able to take it around with him which he enjoys. It's perfect to satisfy his curious, beginner's scientific mind. However, as he gets older, we would want a stronger, precise magnifiying power.
customer_reviews.author: wifenmommy

customer_reviews.title: Nice starter microscope for the kids
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my daughter, and she loves it, we look at insects or in the summer if you take a drop of rain water from outside which has been sitting for a while and look inside, you can see some amazing insects running around. This microscope has three lenses which have different zoom, the highest zoom comes really close to the slide so you cant put anything big to look at as the lens comes really close to the slide.
customer_reviews.author: Rizwan

customer_reviews.title: 10 year old boy loved this
customer_reviews.text: Christmas present for my 10 year old, he already had a smaller microscope and loves science and learning new things on his own. This microscope is the ticket! He finds all types of things around the house to look at, even pulling hairs off of each of our heads to exam.
customer_reviews.author: Dana T.

customer_reviews.title: THUMBS UP!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 11 year old niece's birthday. Was very excited for her to open it. Also purchased set of 25 prepared slides to go along with it to peak her interest in using the microscope. Sure enough, everyone was enjoying looking at the slides underneath the microscope at her party (especially me)!! It comes with a couple of slides and things to mount your own specimens for study. The light that it has really helps you see the specimens clearly. Only had microscope for a week no problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: Debra H.

customer_reviews.title: So glad that I was able to buy a used one ...
customer_reviews.text: My grandson received this from me for his birthday and really loves it. My daughter says the construction is solid and works really well. I ordered this used from the warehouse and nothing was wrong with it except for a slight damage to the packaging. So glad that I was able to buy a used one because money was a little tight. My grandson has been making slides and keeping a journal. Thank you so much for this.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree

customer_reviews.title: Great for the younger kids
customer_reviews.text: Our grandchildren are ages 7 and 9. Everyone knows how very expensive microscopes are. But, for this price, and the age of the children, this was a good choice. None of us are scientists, we are not rating how this compares to more expensive microscopes. The children are fascinated in seeing more clearly what the human eye does not. So, it was worth the money to awaken their curiosity, and enhance their perception of the more delicate nature of the world around them.
customer_reviews.author: Betd5

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent microscope! Easy to use and perfect for all ages! We tested out a number of slides and even some random items from the yard and house! The magnification is excellent! This says top rated toy, but it's great for any at home scientist! I do wish the slides that come with it had some instructions so you knew how to use the dies and tools to make your own slides, but we can google it I'm sure. Overall I would HIGHLY recommend this microscope!
customer_reviews.author: Couponlady32

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas present for our 6 year old granddaughter. The quality of the microscope is very good, and our granddaughter as well as many others enjoyed looking at the sample items I had included in with the gift. For example, I had found a dead spider on our porch, and with the microscope, we could clearly see his multiple eyes!
customer_reviews.author: Incognito

customer_reviews.title: But I was slightly disappoint -- and it was my fault
customer_reviews.text: It is a solid product. But I was slightly disappoint -- and it was my fault, I admit. Namely, I thought the product was more powerful than it in fact is. For example, if you look at blood under this microscope, the only detail you will see is just some gray dots. Nothing fascinating or interesting. The magnification is just not strong enough for that type of experience. Good though for looking at bugs and skin.
customer_reviews.author: Ferdino

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for christmas and it was his first microscope. When I received it I thought with as light as it was and the kinda cheesy old school packaging I was worried it wasn't going to be very good to look through. I was WRONG. For the price this microscope works very well for a first timer. I was impressed. My son loves it. He wants to set up his room like a mad science lab now.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: but I've been able to get pretty clear images of everything I've looked at
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for school, but am already looking forward to playing with it with my nephew when he gets old enough. It's extremely light weight, but it gets the job done for a college anatomy and physiology online class. It only has course focus, but I've been able to get pretty clear images of everything I've looked at. My box was supposed to have cover slips, but they were missing upon receipt.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca W

customer_reviews.title: great gift for my 8 year old
customer_reviews.text: wonderful microscope... not too heavy, but not too light either. It lights from underneath and switches to above for larger specimens. ... And it comes with a little kit to make ones own slides as well as a couple of pre-made ones. As my daughter's first microscope, I am very pleased with my purchase for the price I paid. In addition to this, I purchased a little wooden box AmScope 25pc Assorted Specimen Collection of Prepared Microscope Slides... We are very happy with this combination.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Eyepiece disintegrated instantly
customer_reviews.text: Opened it up on my son's birthday tonight, and while gently putting in the eyepiece, the entire plastic eyepiece disetegrated into several pieces that the instructions don't explain how to put back together. He wants to use it tonight, and we can't. Bday magic lost with this present. This is cheap quality, simply put. I'll be calling tomorrow morning for assistance in reassembling this plastic pile of an eyepiece.
customer_reviews.author: David E. Houser

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Family Microscope
customer_reviews.text: Bought this microscope as a present for my 8 year old last Christmas. It is the end of March now and it has seen consistent use since purchase. It is rugged enough to take into the field (although I had to fabricate a carrying case). The optics are very good, the controls simple to master. I wanted a scope that my son could grow into and I am certain that this was the right choice. Full Disclosure: I enjoy this scope as much as my son does. It has been a lot of fun to explore the very small again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ziebell

customer_reviews.title: excellent choice for a first microscope
customer_reviews.text: When Ben (10 years old) opened this gift for Christmas, he was able to start enjoying it right away. It is simple to use and very durable. It is neat that there is a light on the top as well as the bottom so that opaque items can be seen up close as well. Within minutes Ben and his siblings were fascinated by checking out paper with print on it, hair, an onion peel, and more. My only suggestion might be to include more by way of prepared slides. However, it is also good for them to make their own and have their own ideas, too. Plus, the price was an absolutely fantastic value.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Steve Mulder

customer_reviews.title: I love that it is also a 3D
customer_reviews.text: Wow my son REALLY loves this microscope. Got it for his 10th birthday. I love that it is also a 3D, which means that in addition to viewing slides, he can also set a piece of carpet,hair, grass,coins, bugs, or whatever he wants on there and examine it. I kind of wish it plugged in and didn't run on batteries, but other than that, this is a perfect starter microscope and will provide hours and hours of learning fun.
customer_reviews.author: brandi

customer_reviews.title: Decent little microscope, but light is WAY too bright
customer_reviews.text: Works fairly well, and the included accessories are decent for an entry level microscope. My biggest gripe is that the LED backlight is much too bright, actually blinding. There is no way to control its intensity, and the diaphragm ring does little to control the intensity. I wish there was a dimmer control, I'm actually concerned about my kids eye safety, so I try to use old batteries that put out a less intense light, and/or filter the light.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Look at these bug legs!
customer_reviews.text: My girls (7 and 10) received this as a gift. They don't play with it a lot, but they do pull it out occasionally to look at their premade slides. Honestly, a toy that gets brought out once a month is a win in our house. I am not a microscope expert so I can't really say how well it is compared to other microscopes, but I do know that you can see the details of the slides very well and it is easy to use for a novice like me, and even my elementary aged children.
customer_reviews.author: Lori W.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Inexpensive Microscope
customer_reviews.text: This unit is well built and works well, unlike some competing models which are difficult to focus. This is not a laboratory instrument, but is perfect for a child with and interest in science. I would recommend buying additional slides to go with this microscope, because the slides it comes with a fairly limited. But you can't beat the price and the quality of this microscope.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Kitchen

customer_reviews.title: she didn't understand how much fun she would have but her excitement grew as she ...
customer_reviews.text: Our 7 year old granddaughter is enjoying her first microscope. We read the reviews and bought it as a Christmas present. At first, she didn't understand how much fun she would have but her excitement grew as she observes so many items with it. The quality and price are excellent. Her grandfather is a high school science teacher and he is very impressed with it, too. This is not a toy. It is a gift to encourage the love of science.
customer_reviews.author: Settingapenname

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and fun
customer_reviews.text: Used for years for middle school student who is in college now. Just passed on to another grade school learner. Great product and lots of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Lois

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this one and am very pleased. It is lightweight plastic and doesn't seem super ...
customer_reviews.text: After ordering a slightly cheaper one and finding the quality lacking, I ordered this one and am very pleased. It is lightweight plastic and doesn't seem super high quality at first, but the lenses are fantastic! There are only three settings, but they all work as they should and provide clear views. (Unlike the cheaper one, which had 9 ineffective settings). And we love that it has a top light for looking at things that aren't transparent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great microscope for your budding biologist.
customer_reviews.text: Great little microphone for kids at a reasonable price. I got this for my 11 year old granddaughter who loves science. My daughter, who is in the medical industry, says it works great. Has a clear field of view and she is able to show my granddaughter cellular structures and microscopic organisms. Very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality and a nice first microscope for my 9 ...
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first of this microscope because a lot of other reviews stated it was flimsy. I beg to differ. Very good quality and a nice first microscope for my 9 year. We plan on using this over the summer when we check our farm animals for worms.
customer_reviews.author: Organic Mom

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we were looking for
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves science, but she is 6 so we needed a "functional" microscope that would not break the bank. We got one from the toy store that felt, pretty much like a toy and everything looked like a blur - even without slides! Returned that one and got this one solely based on the reviews. Glad we did - very clear easy to use. It is plastic so do not expect it to be heavy as real microscopes are.
customer_reviews.author: Onfus

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This is the second microscope I purchased. The first one came and the 40x objective lens was scratched beyond belief. This one at least has no scratches but the 40x objective is pretty useless. I'm so disappointed with this microscope.
customer_reviews.author: ZmbCwgrl

customer_reviews.title: Still using it 5 years later!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this on 12/11/12 for $94 and it is still being used! Our niece wanted it when she was 10. To this day, she and her older brothers keep it set up in their basement rec room and use it often! Great value! Great product. I'm going to purchase for my granddaughter now.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Good value indeed!
customer_reviews.text: This did indeed meet my expectations, which were based on reviews here on Amazon. It's ability to handle both conventional slides and solid objects greatly enhances its attractiveness to kids (which isn't easy in this age of video game alternatives). For the price it's a great value. Our unit had an optical aberration, but an e-mail to the company (C&A Scientific) received a response within 20 minutes; they shipped a new scope without further trial or tribulation. Recommended for quality, value, and customer service.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: My 3rd grade son loves this microscope. We did our own cheek swab, turned out just fine on the slides. I can't see any difference between this and ones I've used at school in the past. My 3 year old caught something floating around in her bathwater and gave it to me to throw away. It was so tiny, I couldn't identify if it was a bug or not and had a feeling it was. How handy to have this microscope. The kids got a kick to find that it was a crazy looking furry creature. It looked like a baby beetle with orange, yellow, and black hairs. Possibly a baby lady bug. Anyway, we all enjoy this quality product.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Love this microscope for slide and solid objects.
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect microscope for my seven year old son. Easy to use with prepared slides that we had on hand but more importantly it works with solid objects like leaves, flowers, insects and rocks. We even looked at our fingers and hair. Lights up from both the top and bottom. Great microscope for the price. Built soundly and shipped with care. I would recommend this for every parent as I bel its a wonderful tool to introduce science. I'm very happy I got this one.
customer_reviews.author: nebula

customer_reviews.title: A good starter set and worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Duo-Scope for my 6yr old Granddaughter. She is a little young but it will last her for several years. I enjoy bringing over samples of different things for her to look at and it stimulates her interest and knowledge of science at the same time. It is not something she will use everyday but it gives a little balance to all the toys. A good starter set and worth the price in its educational value alone.
customer_reviews.author: Athabasco

customer_reviews.title: Oh so much fun
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a Christmas present for the family and chose the duo scope so we could get up close an personal with the rocks we love to collect. It is amazing what we've seen after each trek to the desert for samples. I do wish we could use the 40xs on the rocks instead of just the 4 and 10, but the light that shines from the top doesn't hit our samples in the right location for us to get a clear view at that magnification.
customer_reviews.author: E and the Boys

customer_reviews.title: Ok.
customer_reviews.text: I returned this product because there were specks in the view no matter how much you cleaned it. It is very light and feels like it would easily break, the light is not adjustable and will pretty much blind you, on the closest zoom the picture is not very clear. But, for the price if purchasing for a younger child this would probably do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Jen K

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING
customer_reviews.text: This arrived on excellent form and has been nothing but a really great learning tool in our house. I got this instead of toys that he might not like one week later. Now he wants to explore outside, get samples, and use the scope to look at the samples. Very worthwhile and the investment isn't bad either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still working well after four years
customer_reviews.text: We are homeschoolers. I purchased this microscope when my older son was doing high school biology. This microscope was good enough to complete the various assignments in his lab book that year. We have since pulled it out several times a year for various projects, and it is still functioning just fine and serving its purpose. My 9 year old son is now the primary user of the microscope, and it is holding up well to his use of it, and I will admit he is a little rougher on objects than his older brother is.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: The scope itself was dirty and scratched
customer_reviews.text: Product box arrived badly damaged with small box holding glass slides inside box also badly damaged. Shipping box had NO damage. The scope itself was dirty and scratched, like it was a used product. This was a birthday gift for a 9 year old boy. NOT happy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas present for my , then 5 yo , and she loves it .We often sit together for a couple of hours playing "laboratory " and looking at most random things through this microscope . It's great quality , and I would recommended it for all the little and big scientist out there :)
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: BOX WAS DAMAGED AND MICROSCOPE WAS CLEARLY USED.. ...
customer_reviews.text: BOX WAS DAMAGED AND MICROSCOPE WAS CLEARLY USED ....WHICH NO WHERE IN THE DESCRIPTION DID IT STATE THAT I WOULD RECEIVE A USED PRODUCT. ASIDE FROM THAT....THE MICROSCOPE IS SUPPOSE TO COME WITH OVER 50 PIECES OF ACCESSORIES AND IT CAME WITH ZERO!! RETURNING IMMEDIATELY AND WILL NOT REORDER. I GUESS THEY THOUGHT I WOULDN'T NOTICE THE 50 MISSING PIECES!?!
customer_reviews.author: Missing All Asccessories

customer_reviews.title: Perfect 1st Microscope!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a birthday present for our 10 year old niece and it was very well received! She's starting to sh ow an interest in Science, so we wanted to get her a real microscope (not a toy). It has many nice features. including a dual light source & multiple magnification settings. I will definitely look to buy this again when my own children are old enough.
customer_reviews.author: CFrieberg

customer_reviews.title: seems sturdy, some flaws
customer_reviews.text: One of the duo lights on mine did not work out of the box. Called the company, they did not have any spare parts and referred me to amazon. Amazon will only refund and not exchange but they do off a full refund. Seems to be sturdy, the scope holds steady and does not slip down. The highest magnification is pointless as it touches the slide before it even begins to get into focus. The other magnifications are easy to focus and look pretty good. The lights when working are pretty brite.
customer_reviews.author: Max Power

customer_reviews.title: Microscope light switch broken out of the box
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent microscope for the money. My daughter still likes it. But it is important to know before ordering that the quality control on these microscopes may not be up to par. Out of the box, the light switch will not turn the light off. We have to remove the batteries to turn the light off. I'll be sending the microscope back for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: kinorob

customer_reviews.title: My First Lab Duo Scope Microscope
customer_reviews.text: Got the toy in time for my kid's recognition day at school. He was amazed by the toy's capability! The magnification was okay up to the 10x option but image is a little blurred when you crank it up to the 400x. Just be careful when rotating the magnification knob, it might get loose easily. Also the light below the slide blinks a bit . Sort of loose I guess but with proper adjustment, it will work fine. Get more of those pre-prepared slides for continual enjoyment with your kids. Great scientific experience for them!
customer_reviews.author: Ariel A. Pitagan

customer_reviews.title: Well made, easy to use microscope
customer_reviews.text: I don't speak from experience, I bought this for my niece, but according to her dad, the microscope is of high quality, it is easy to use and with optional (found elsewhere on Amazon) prepared slides which provide much diversity. My niece is now 8 years old and is quite science/nature minded and apparently she is old enough to own and use this microscope and loves it! Her and her dad say "Big Thumbs Up!"
customer_reviews.author: Mr Axolotl

customer_reviews.title: Good scope, though smudge on 40x lens.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well, but the 40x lens seems to have a smudge (fingerprint?) on the inside of the lens, so you can't wipe it off. Too much hassle to return it, so we'll work around it. We're not looking at too many things at 400x right now, so not a big deal. My daughter and I enjoyed looking at some water creatures brought from the local pond and flower pollen so far. Good bonding stuff for adults and kids.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Doodley

customer_reviews.title: Packaging doesn't do the product justice
customer_reviews.text: I got this for the kids and they absolutely love it. Started taking samples from all over the house to see what lives - much to the chagrin of the wife. They commented that the quality of the microscope was better than their school experience. One recommendation to the manufacturer - loose the packaging. My kids commented that the packaging led them to believe that this scope was too juvenile, but once they checked it out, they (and I) were impressed with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Wakey-Wakey

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch
customer_reviews.text: Great price, Great Optics (given the application). If you have a budding scientist or just a curious mind buy this for some great learning and fun. My son loves the top and bottom light (duo-scope), it makes this instrument much more versatile than I would have thought. The battery power makes it great for dragging it out into the field. I couldn't be more happy. One niggle is the focus knob will drive the platform into the largest optic if you're not careful, easy enough to work around but sometimes an annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: Hike & Bike

customer_reviews.title: Cheap solution for classroom science
customer_reviews.text: Simple microscopes i bough for my classroom. Nice feature is that it has 2 lighting options. the one below is for viewing slides. the top is for using like a magnifying glass. it is perfect for seeing the features on the rock collection i purchased for earth science. Only draw back is there is no fine focus.
customer_reviews.author: stephen Dillon

customer_reviews.title: A great piece for anyone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for having a little fun looking at the various things littered around my house. And have been nothing but completely satisfied with it I found the magnification to be prefect for most things. And the light is bright enough to give a clear view of the object your studying also it's slim design allows it to be stored easily. All in all a great buy if your not looking for some top of the line microscope. Plus the addition of tools and prepared slides are great so you can enjoy your microscope instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Animestein

customer_reviews.title: Got for a 10 year old, works great
customer_reviews.text: Has two settings for lighting, either from below to illuminate the slides for higher magnification or from above to illuminate the larger items that require lower magnification. This is of the same quality that you might have used in high school which is great for a first time user like my kid. Everything works just fine. Not high end but that is not what we were looking for. We'll worry about that when she working on her doctorate dissertation ;)
customer_reviews.author: Brewdog760

customer_reviews.title: purchased for 9-year old
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is curious so she received this microscope for Christmas. She has looked at tons of things. It is sturdy for a basic tool works well and has nice features. 3 different powers for viewing, 8 different light hole settings, top and bottom lights, etc. Has a few prepared slides to view and some basics for making your own samples. My daughter is able to work this on her own and really enjoys it - almost as much as I do!
customer_reviews.author: Mama Henschells

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical about purchasing this but I was pleased I did
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for a newbie. Its lightweight for young children to carry around and the kids love it. They have the additional slides as well. They collect things in the yard and are able to see them clearly. Each magnifying glass works well amd are very clear. I would definitely buy again
customer_reviews.author: Lo

customer_reviews.title: First, the battery powered led lights are extremely dim ...
customer_reviews.text: First, the battery powered led lights are extremely dim, so this needs a separate light or used outside during the day. Second, I can't contact product support to try to exchange to see if another light works.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Quality scope I have had a few and this one beats them all It was a gift for my son beautiful clarity **updated too say we have tried other scopes and this one still by far out performs all others we have tried!!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

product_meta.title: My First Lab Duo-Scope Microscope - MFL-06
product_meta.description:
# 1 Best-Selling Microscope, from the makers of REAL scientific equipment 

 The award-winning Duo-Scope 2-in 1 microscope delivers hours of hands-on learning and fun, keeping kids engaged in science instead of glued to TV or phone! Ages 9 and up. 

 • Includes 50-piece science accessory and experiment kit - you can make your slides
• 2 Scopes in 1 – View 3D objects AND prepared slides
• Experiment Guide and Instruction Manual Included
• Sparks creativity - explore the world around you!
• Powerful magnification and clarity– 10x eyepiece up to 400X magnification
• Lightweight - Perfect for indoor or outdoor use
• Award-winning - Made from a company that has been bringing quality microscopes to children for over 25 years
• Supports STEM (science, technology, engineering, and math) learning 

 My First Lab we help kids of all ages discover, learn, and grow. 

 PACKED with a 50-Piece Science Kit!
• 5 blank slides
• 1 concavity (well) slide
• 4 prepared slides
• 2 bottles of stain
• Forceps
• Plastic test tube
• Plastic Petri dish
• Experiment Guide and Operating Manual
• And more! 

 Requires 3 AA batteries (not included) 

 STEM-Based Learning. With the same technology by lab professionals and REAL scientists around the world, the scope fosters creative thinking that develops critical learning skills and confidence in kids through STEM (science, technology, engineering, and math) based learning. 



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Duo-Scope is a dual functioning biological microscope that incorporates modified objectives with dual cool LED illumination! This allows the user to view both microscopic sized specimens on slides as well as macroscopic (solid) objects like bugs, stamps and coins!
feature_bullets: AWARD WINNING STEM MICROSCOPE - The My First Lab Duo-Scope Microscope is an Award Winning Microscope for STEM education. The Duo-Scope functions as a compound and stereo microscope in one unit. This allows you to view microscope slides as well as three dimensional items such as rocks and leaves.

50 PIECE ACCESSORY KIT INCLUDED - The Duo-Scope contains a 50 piece accessory kit insuring the fun starts as soon as the box is opened. The Accessory kit includes 5 plain slides, 1 concavity (well) slide, 4 prepared slides, cover glass, plastic dropper, slide labels, lens paper, forceps, plastic test tune, plastic Petri Dish, straight teasing needle and more!

INSTRUCTION MANUAL WITH HELPFUL HINTS - Item includes the accessories and instruction manual for helping you to make your own prepared slides and tips for usage. The manual also includes an experiment guide that will encourage further exploration.
REAL GLASS OPTICS - This microscope comes equipped with real glass optics. Each Duo-Scope comes with a 10X eyepiece as well as 4X, 10X, 40X glass objective gicing you 40X, 100X, 400X Magnification.
1 YEAR MANUFACTURER WARRANTY - One-year manufacturer warranty to protect your investment in your child's learning.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,793 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
